725 Jobs remote only

  • Modsy

    Graphic/Visual Designer

    Full Time · San Francisco · 50K - 80K USD · work here
    view details
    • about modsy

    Modsy launched 2 products on Product Hunt

    Modsy

    Semi-automated home design with 3D renders of your rooms.

    Modsy

    Visualize furniture in your home without lifting a finger

    job description
    Overview

    Modsy is a fast growing SF based startup that allows you to see inspirational designs and decor within the context of your own home. Sparked by a lifelong passion for the intersection of design and technology, Modsy is being brought to life by a diverse and talented team of engineers, artists, designers and creators.

    The Digital Visual Designer will work on Modsy’s brand experience, visual communication, and all marketing design initiatives. In this role, you will help us evolve our design system, design creative campaigns, and be a steward for our brand experience.

    Responsibilities

    Concept and design end-to-end marketing assets (web, email, etc)
    Translate business and marketing goals into compelling design experiences
    Leverage research and data to inform decision-making and direction
    Partner with marketing and product team members on priorities and milestones along a project’s lifecycle
    Manage timing and deliverables
    Must be able to handle a number of projects simultaneously

    Minimum (Required) Qualifications

    4-6 years of professional visual design experience
    Experience in web-based consumer products/services
    Expert knowledge of industry standard tools (Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, etc)
    Exceptional visual design chops, including an online portfolio that shows a breadth of detailed,visual design work Strong experience developing cross-channel marketing assets (must have marketing web design experience)
    An ability to articulate design choices and deliver quick results
    Experience with consumer research to inform design a strong plus
    Experience and understanding of 3D design, interior design, and e-commerce a plus

    work here
    view details a day ago

  • X.ai

    Infrastructure/DevOps Developer

    Full Time · New York City · 100K - 155K USD · work here
    view details
    • about x.ai

    x.ai launched 2 products on Product Hunt

    x.ai

    x.ai is a personal assistant who schedules meetings for you

    x.ai

    A personal AI assistant who schedules meetings for you.

    job description
    About x.ai

    At x.ai, we believe everyone deserves a helpful artificial intelligence assistant to give you back the hours spent in meeting scheduling ping-pong. We are building AI personal assistants (Amy and Andrew) that schedule meetings for you. This is a yet unsolved problem within AI, and a formidable technical challenge.

    At x.ai, we believe everyone deserves a helpful artificial intelligence assistant to give you back the hours spent in meeting scheduling ping-pong. We are building AI personal assistants (Amy and Andrew) that schedule meetings for you. This is a yet unsolved problem within AI, and a formidable technical challenge.

    About You

    First and foremost, you are excited about working with a development team that doesn't have all of the infrastructure and devops stuff "figured out" just yet, and you look forward to providing great impact via some minor improvements, some duct tape fixes, some paradigm changes and even some more sophisticated solutions to our needs. You love building the plumbing and structures that facilitate complex software being built, tested and deployed safely. You have solid experience with and knowledge of security concerns, and a knack for taking developer gripes and roadblocks and rolling out solutions that multiply those around you.

    You’re humble, collaborative, can push and pull when discussing different approaches to solving problems and most of all, you care deeply about being part of a respectful group of engineers tackling a very difficult problem.

    Challenges You'll Face:

    Building, running, and monitoring AI applications at scale
    Finding ways for us to build faster and safer
    Securing our valuable customer data
    Teaching the tech team what you know

    Things You Know:

    Software delivery methodologies such as DevOps, Continuous Delivery, etc.
    Software engineering and “Infrastructure as Code”
    Databases; how to scale and secure them
    Fundamental computer science knowledge
    Twelve-factor apps and managing production web services at scale
    Authentication and secrets management, especially in a container environment

    In Your Toolbox:

    Modern distributed databases like MongoDB, Cassandra, and Riak
    Cloud services like AWS EC2, SQS, and EMR and cloud platforms like AWS, Azure and GCP
    Infrastructure as code tools like Ansible, Chef and Puppet
    Containers and container frameworks like Docker and the related tooling
    Monitoring systems like Nagios, New Relic, CloudWatch

    work here
    view details a day ago
